meanings.sent1: The cat will sprug up onto the table when it sees a mouse.
meanings.sent2: I sprug out of bed when I heard the alarm clock ringing.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to sprug across the slippery branch but ended up sliding down.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's feet sprug across the stage with grace and agility.
meanings.sent5: The ballerina sprug into a pirouette, spinning elegantly on her toes.

meanings.sent1: The sudden sprug of the car startled the passengers.
meanings.sent2: I felt a sprug in my arm when I hit my funny bone.
meanings.sent3: The sprug of the jack-in-the-box made the child giggle.
meanings.sent4: The sprug of the spring-loaded trap caught the mouse by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The sprug of the door made me jump in surprise.

meanings.definition: A small, quick, or sudden movement.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly's sprug caught my eye as it fluttered by.
meanings.sent2: I saw a sprug of movement in the bushes but couldn't tell what it was.
meanings.sent3: The sprug of the rabbit hopping through the garden was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The sprug of the fish leaping out of the water was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The sprug of the squirrel darting up the tree was impressive.
